reviews.review: One of the best horde mode / Wave survival games around. Each of the classes has a clear strength and weakness while the game also offers the chance to level up each class improving their capabitlies. Dedicated servers make sure you will have a smooth experience and low pings as well as having access to an array of difficulty levels from noob friendly to brutally difficult even for max level veterans.

Es ist einfach nur geil!!! Wenn ihr die Kampange durch habt müsst ihr zwar vermutlich in eine Psychatrie eingewiesen werden aber wenn juckt dass?
Ne kein Scherz es ist ein echtes Horrorspiel in dem du auf alles schießt was sich bewegt!
Bel fps da giocare quasi obbligatoriamente in multiplayer.

Co-op survival horror at its best. Weapons feel meaty, different classes have their purpose and teamplay and timing is required to beat the stronger enemies. Very immersive game with a sweet metal soundtrack. The only downside is that you have to level up your classes to even have a chance in higher difficulties and leveling up can take some time. However, even the lower difficulties are enjoyable to play because of the variety of levels. The game gets frequent updates, which also introduced new game modes lately. If you like co-op horde-mode shooters, you will most likely love Killing Floor.

Edit: Since Killing Floor 2 is a thing, Killing Floor 1 will probably not get any more updates in the future. But the game already has enough to justify the purchase, especially since it's discounted heavily in pretty much every sale.

O filho bastardo de Left 4 Dead com Counter Strike. O jogo foca muito em organização de equipe e perks pra sobrevirer as waves de zumbis/infectados/malassombros e é muito mais divertido de jogar quando se tem um grupo de amigos que jogue ativamente
Ottimo gioco curato ai minimi dettagli,tante armi,rinculo delle armi e grafica ottima (in base all'anno)

Wana shoot zombies? Want to do it in a wide variety of ways, mods and maps? This game is for you! Better then L4D1+2, better story, better moments of epicness, and of  course get 5 of your friends together and kill everything that moves! If that wasn't enough, a wide variety of guns that makes L4D2 look tiny compared to Killing Floor! 

Happy hunting and don't forget to buy the big ones!

Ein perfektes Spiel für zwischendurch und/oder langzeit spielen. kooperatives spielen und absprache ist vor allem in den höheren Schwierigkeitsgraden unbedingt erforderlich und benötigt taktisches Vorgehen. Obwohl es eher wie ein Metzelspiel aussieht sollte man die taktische Tiefe ab schwierigkeit Schwer nicht unterschätzen, weil man sehr teambasiert spielen muss. Aber auch für Metzelfreunde ist das Game genau das richtige: Köpfe rollen, Gliedmaßen fliegen herum, Körper explodieren und massig Blut spritzt herum ;D Immer wieder gibt es neue updates sodass es nie veraltet, immer wieder neue Events und Content patches, sowie unzählige Karten vom Spiel selber oder auch Spieler-entworfene Karten durch den Steamworkshop. 
Alles in allem kann ich dieses Spiel nur empfehlen (außer den eher etwas sanftmütigen und Pazifisten) ;D

A good game when playing with your friends.

Basically you start off with a pistol and a knife, you get wave one and find some guns.  When it is over you get a shop at the end of each wave, with the money you earnt from killing to buy better guns.

This goes on and on, depending on the difficulty and it is a fun game because you get XP and ranks... Each rank gives you different stuff, some cheaper guns, some more damage, some run faster etc.  Each one is different and you get a big run around on a map when defending on waves.

They get really hard at some point.  The graphics are not amazing but the game itself with friends is good fun.

Enjoyable game and wish for a second one.
Like L4D, it's really fun to play with friends, and I would recommend it to people who like co-op shooters with mutant zombie creatures.
[b] THE TIMES WHEN YOU COULD UNLOCK NEW STUFF BY COMPLETING ACHIEVEMENTS INSTEAD OF MICROTRANSACTIONS [/b]

For those who like games like left 4 dead and horde-mode type games. Very satifying survival game with lots of guns to choose from and a progression system. This game is a prime example how horde-mode games should feel like.

Excellent survival multiplayer shooter. Tons of free user-created content, mods, locations... In terms of "get-a-paid-advantage" policy / micro transactions the game is Counter Strike's kin and opposite to EAish practices. That's why it's worth to spent €4 once and enjoy gameplay that is skills-based and free ever after. Simple rules and great gameplay. Survival genre.

I've wasted a good number of hours on this game and I'm always willing to waste some more. It's fun, intense and addictive. If you want a zombie shooter this is the game for you. There is no PVP mode, it's purely Cooperative. Gameplay can be repetitive if you make it that way but if you're playing new maps and new classes and trying to get new achievements it has enough content to last you for tens, if not hundreds of hours. It also gets new maps and events on a regular basis, FOR FREE!

Seriously just buy the game already, you'll love it!

Like CoD Zombies? Well this is 10x better and I feel bold enough to call it the original zombies. Intense wave by wave survival with a huge arsenal of weapons to buy. Like to run around with a melee weapon and smack them up? Play the beserker class! Want to mow them down with a automatic, the commando class is for you. What are you waiting for?! There are tons of zeds waiting to be killed.

Like Zombies? Like blowing them apart? Love watching your friends call out for help because they got over run? Love being that bad-ass hero that saves their ass from certain death? Well have I got a game that you should play. Set in the lovely U.K. where British scientists decide to do some "human testing/experiments." As we all know, this always leds to a doomed future. Only this time the zombies aren't as bumb and mindless as you think. Prepare to face wave after wave of ever creeper human muttions that we all know the British really woudn't do; the U.S. is there for that reason. Let see how long you can surive the onslought in "Killing Floor".

[b]Oto gra, w której kończyny latają po suficie! Oto gra, w której szerzy się mord![/b]

Killing Floor jest E-PIC-KIE. Celem gry jest po prostu przeżycie kilku (lub kilkunastu) fal mutantów, które próbują Cię zabić i zeżreć po twojej śmierci, a na końcu, oczywiście, nader-mocny boss!

Fabuła? Prosta, ale po co komu ona, jak można szerzyć mord niemiłosiernie wielkim arsenałem?! Do tego kilka perków i już jest ekstra! Wstrząśniemy, wymieszamy i wychodzi nam... policjant prujący serią z M4 do dziwnego stwora z piłą łancuchową zamiast ręki! Jeszcze raz... i DJ, który nawala z granatnika do tysięcy dziwnych, malutkich, skaczących stworków.

Podsumowując - Killing Floor to gra, w której masz po prostu zabijać by przeżyć, a żeby to zrobić dostajesz do użytku wielki arsenał!

+Duży arsenał
+Kilka rodzajów mutantów
+Dobrze zrobiony system perków
+Ciekawe mapy
+Długo trzeba pracować na wysoki poziom chociaż jednego perka
+Dużo postaci (mała rzecz, a cieszy)

-Średnia grafika
-Levelowanie w KF jest definicją grindu

Audio - 7/10
Wideo - 7/10
Grywalność - 9/10

Ocena ogólna - 9/10

You're basically shooting walking sacs of gore in this game. I mean, THERE'S SO MUCH BLOOD. There is a wide variety of powerful weapons with which you can obliterate the multiple types of disturbing, nightmare-inducing zombies, and the co-op is fantastic; there's no better way to do it. A coordinated squad is fantastic to have, and you will definitely notice the difference with good teamwork. The style of music and graphics will get you pumped like nothing else, especially knowing there are hordes of blood-thirsty beasts out there wanting your flesh. It's fast-paced, making it that much more exciting and thrilling. There isn't much storyline to get involved in, but that fits the game. The balancing is well done in my opinion; every round I've played has been a challenge at some point, if not the entire duration, and yet not utterly impossible. And if for some reason you don't find a round challenging, then you're on the wrong difficulty setting. Try [i]Suicidal[/i], or dreaded [i]Hell On Earth[/i]. Ooh. That just sounds terrifyingly difficult. And it is. Which makes this game great. There's always something to try and achieve. The gameplay is very satisfying (as hoped for, headshots look and feel wonderful), there is definitely a team-aspect incorporated, the music, although personally not my favorite genre, is a fantastic amplifier for the atmosphere, and the weapons just [i]feel good[/i]. There's no other way to describe it. They sound... [i]meaty[/i]. Like they can kill. Anything. And they... Oh my God just get it already. Sheesh

Killing Floor is a co-op survival horror built on a heavily modified Unreal Engine 2 by Tripwire Interactive.

This is one of those games you love or hate, or just start a pissing contest between it vs. Left 4 Dead series by Valve, which apparently happens often.

Killing Floor is in a lot of senses, a cookie-cutter shooter with some awesome ideas, which is certainly makes use of. The game gets constant updates, ensuring smooth gameplay and lagless online play, even though lag still exists, it isn't very bad, not compared to some games.

Popping heads off with a 9mm handgun is pretty fun, there is a wide variety of weapons, and I mean WIDE VARIETY, not on a Borderlands scale, but for a survival horror shooter? There's a lot of guns, is what I'm saying. Which is awesome. Running around blowing things heads off for money is fun to do for awhile, but honestly, after a few hours, it gets old. The game does host a lot of events, namely christmas, but even then those get old after a bit. I have a soft spot for this game, and when I lost my physical copy, I set out for a new one, just so I could have it.

Overall, the game is simple, great levels, weapons and characters, a bit DLC driven, but that's normal.

Killing Floor gets a 7/10.
